title: a5m
body:
The [b]Mitsubishi A5M[/b], Japanese Navy designation "Type 96 carrier-based fighter" (九六式艦上戦闘機), was a Japanese carrier-based fighter [[aircraft]] designed by [[Horikoshi Jirou]] and introduced in 1936. The Allied reporting name was [b]Claude[/b].

It was the world's first monoplane shipboard fighter and the direct predecessor of the more famous Mitsubishi [[A6M Zero]], which was largely based on the A5M's design. It is notable for having a fixed undercarriage.

The A5M saw limited use during [[World War II]]. It was considered obsolete by the time of the Attack on [[Pearl Harbor]] and served mainly in the early years of the Sino-Japanese War. The airplane also features in the 2013 anime film [i][[Kaze Tachinu]][/i] ([i]The Wind Rises[/i]), which retells Horikoshi's life.

[[kasuga maru (kancolle)|Kasuga Maru]] notably carries one like a falcon in [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i] as in real life the [i]Taiyou[/i]-class escort carriers were too small to handle newer fighters. 

h4. See also
* [[A6M Zero]]

h4. External Links
* "Wikipedia: Mitsubishi A5M":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mitsubishi_A5M]

title: nagato_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
[[Nagato (Kancolle)|]]'s second remodel/kai ni.
Implemented on May 22, 2017.

h4. Appearance
[tn]See post #2732365 for base kai ni and post #3319070 for Big Seven cut-in CG.[/tn]

On her kai ni form, [i]Nagato[/i] gains a [[black jacket]] with [[short sleeves]], with miniature [[sandbag|sandbags]] on the sleeve ends. The v-neck on her original base form outfit is replaced with a black covering that completely hides her [[cleavage]]. Her existing red [[thighhighs]] are retained, but her [[rudder footwear]] is now integrated to the thighhighs and colored red to match. Her [[white skirt]] and [[sakuramon]] waist rig are also retained, with the [[garter straps]].

As for her rig, she now sports two 41 cm triple mounts superfiring over her original 41 cm twin mounts, with her original 14 cm single casemate mounts replaced entirely with two 12.7 cm [[anti-aircraft gun|twin dual-purpose mounts]], one on each side. Her triple gun turrets also contain 25 mm AA platforms on sandbags, a reference to her real-life mounting of [[anti-aircraft gun]]s on turret tops from 1944 to the end of the war (albeit she never used triple gun mounts as these were merely prototypes). Additional 25 mm AA guns and searchlights are also placed on platforms around the funnel to her back. Her rig is also updated to be more in-line with the real-life [i]Nagato[/i], sporting a true hull design with torpedo bulges, and more 25 mm single AA mounts on the deck.

h4. See also
* [[Mutsu Kai Ni (Kancolle)|]]

title: g4m
body:
The [b]Mitsubishi G4M[/b], also known as 一式陸上攻撃機 ([i]Isshiki Rikujou Kougeki-ki[/i], lit. "type 1 land-based attack aircraft") or its abbreviated name, 一式陸攻 ([i]Isshiki Rikukou[/i] or [i]Isshiki Rikkou[/i]), was a twin engined [[bomber]] for the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] in [[World War II]].

Its Allied codename is [b]Betty[/b]. It is the successor aircraft to Mitsubishi's own [[G3M]] and the de-facto predecessor of the Yokosuka [[P1Y Ginga]] bomber.

The [[airplane]] can be easily distinguished by its [[cigar]]-shaped fuselage, hence the nickname "flying cigar", albeit also attributed to its fragility to anti-air: like the [[A6M Zero]] and the [[Ki-43 Hayabusa]], the early versions of the aircraft achieved their performance (especially range) at the expense of armor and self-sealing fuel tanks, making it vulnerable to enemy machine gun hits. This weakness is increased if the aircraft is used as a torpedo bomber due to its large size. This was what claimed [[Yamamoto Isoroku]]'s life in mid-1943 when he was shot down by US fighters in the Solomon Islands (see post #3810385).

It was designed by Honjou Kirou [本庄 季郎] and entered combat for first time in June 1941.

h4.See also
* Mitsubishi [[G3M]]
* [[List of Airplanes]]

h4. External links
* "English Wikipedia: Mitsubishi G4M":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mitsubishi_G4M]
* "Japanese Wikipedia: Type 1 Attack Aircraft":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%B8%80%E5%BC%8F%E9%99%B8%E4%B8%8A%E6%94%BB%E6%92%83%E6%A9%9F]

title: g3m
body:
Refers to the [b]Mitsubishi G3M Type 96 Attack Aircraft[/b] (Allied [i]Nell[/i]) and the derivative [b]Yokosuka L3Y Type 96 Transport[/b] (Allied [i]Tina[/i]).

Originally designed as a land-based long-range [[bomber]] for the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]], mainly to fulfill [[Yamamoto Isoroku]]'s request for long-range, high-speed bombers that can carry [[torpedo]]es. This, unfortunately, came at the cost of defensive armor and self-sealing fuel tanks, making them extremely vulnerable to being shot down with even simple small-arms fire.

The Yokosuka Naval Arsenal produced a transport variant named the L3Y.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Mitsubishi G3M":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mitsubishi_G3M]

title: g2h
body:
The [b]Hiro Naval Arsenal G2H[/b] was an [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] long-range [[bomber]]/recon plane developed in the 1930s. The unreliability of its Hiro Type 94 engines doomed the project after just 8 aircraft built, but it provided the IJN with experience in designing better successor bombers.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Hiro G2H":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hiro_G2H]

title: p-39_airacobra
body:
The [b]Bell P-39 Airacobra[/b] was an interwar period fighter aircraft, very innovative for its time due to having tricycle landing gear as well as cannon armament. Certain problems with its engine at high attitudes (attributed to a lack of a decent turbo-supercharger) made it limited in [[United States Air Force]] service during WWII, however it was popular amongst Soviet forces, with many of them being sent there due to Lend Lease and most successful against Luftwaffe aircraft.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Bell P-39":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bell_P-39_Airacobra]

title: b-26_marauder
body:
The [b]Martin B-26 Marauder[/b] was a [[United States Air Force]] twin-engine medium bomber that saw service in World War II, mostly in Europe.

The B-26 was notorious for its high 241 kph landing speed that killed or injured pilots and crews alike to the point that it was named the "Widowmaker" and "Martin Murderer". The landing problems were solved with the introduction of the B-26B-10 with longer wings and a taller vertical stabilizer.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Martin B-26":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martin_B-26_Marauder]

title: pby_catalina
body:
The [b]Consolidated PBY Catalina[/b] was a patrol [[flying boat]] primarily operated by the United States and their Allies in World War II. Originally designed as a patrol bomber with long range required for Pacific operations, it also saw use as a recon aircraft, search-and-rescue, anti-submarine, and transport.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Consolidated PBY":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Consolidated_PBY_Catalina]

title: ss_scharnhorst
body:
Ocean liner under [i]Norddeutscher Lloyd[/i], launched in 1934 and completed in 1935, the second liner named after General Gerhard J. D. von Scharnhorst. She operated the route between Bremen and Yokohama with sister ships [i]SS Potsdam[/i] and [i]SS Gneisenau[/i], but in September 1939, she was trapped in Japan during the outbreak of World War II in Europe, and was later purchased by the Imperial Japanese Navy to be converted into aircraft carrier [i]Shin'you[/i].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: SS Scharnhorst":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SS_Scharnhorst_(1934)]

title: b-21_raider
body:
The [b]Northrop Grumman B-21 Raider[/b] is a stealth strategic bomber under development for the [[United States Air Force]]. Named in honor of the Doolittle Raiders of 1942, the bomber is meant to augment (and ultimately replace) the [[B-2 Spirit]] also designed and manufactured by Northrop Grumman.

h4. See also
* [[B-2 Spirit]] (its predecessor which shares the same flying wing design)
* [[XB-35]] (the original flying wing bomber design, same company)

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Northrop Grumman B-21":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northrop_Grumman_B-21_Raider]

title: b-2_spirit
body:
The Northrop Grumman B-2 Spirit is an American heavy penetration strategic stealth bomber. It uses a flying wing design (no fuselage and tail which are typical in most aircraft) and radar-absorbent materials to largely decrease its radar cross-section. Due to the inherent stability of the flying wing design, it flies by using Fly-By-Wire technology.

It is the most expensive aircraft at $2.1 billion per aircraft in 1997. Hence, with the winding-down of the Cold War, only 21 are built. One crashed in 2008, though the pilots ejected safely.

The aircraft is designed by Northrop Corporation (later Northrop Grumman) which has previously designed the [[XB-35]] and the "YB-49":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northrop_YB-49. The two preceding aircraft are flying wing bombers that did not enter service, but nevertheless became the basis of the B-2's design.

h4.See also

* [[List of Airplanes]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Northrop Grumman B-2 Spirit":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northrop_Grumman_B-2_Spirit

title: angel_chromosome_xx
body:
A series of figures personifying the [[Angel (evangelion)|Angels]] of [i][[Neon Genesis Evangelion]][/i] into human girls. The characters were designed by [[Yoshizaki Mine]].

According to lore, the girls are actually separate beings from the Angels; In an attempt to create a hybrid being, scientists took DNA samples of the defeated Angels and fused them with human DNA. As a result the girls are something of  genetic relatives or children to the Angels, but aren't genderswaps.

title: aichi_e10a
body:
The [b]Aichi E10A[/b] (Type 96 Night Reconnaissance Seaplane, Allied [i]Hank[/i]), was an [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] [[biplane]] flying boat. It was used as a night recon craft but all 15 aircraft built were decommissioned just before Pearl Harbor and not encountered in combat.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Aichi E10A":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aichi_E10A]

title: yokosuka_e14y
body:
The [b]Yokosuka E14Y[/b] (Type 0 Small Reconnaissance Seaplane, Allied [i]Glen[/i]) was an [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] seaplane intended for use aboard submarines.

While the E14Y was used for several Japanese reconnaissance missions during the Pacific War, it remains the only Japanese aircraft to have attacked the United States, flying from I-25 on 9 September 1942.

See post #2477027 for appearance.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Yokosuka E14Y":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yokosuka_E14Y]

title: b-29_superfortress
body:
The [b]Boeing B-29 Superfortress[/b] is a four-engine propeller-driven heavy bomber made in the United States. It is well known for [[atomic bombings of hiroshima and nagasaki|dropping atomic bombs on the Japanese cities]] of [[Hiroshima]] and [[Nagasaki]] to end [[World War II]].

h4. See also
* [[Tu-4]] - Unlicensed Soviet copy of B-29
* [[List of airplanes]]
other_names: B-29スーパーフォートレス

title: armisael_(evangelion)
body:
The sixteenth [[Angel (evangelion)|]] in [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]]. Appears as a large glowing floating torus (3 dimensional circle). In its initial dormant phase, the Angel's body has a double helix structure. During battle, the double helix deconstructs into a single thread, which then lashes out at enemies, utilizing its entire body as a weapon.

The Angel also merged with [[ayanami rei|Rei]] and mentally contacted her, expressing a desire to merge with her and forcing her to feel its pain, which Rei realized was actually loneliness.

title: zeruel_(evangelion)
body: The fourteenth [[Angel (evangelion)|]] in [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]]. Appears as a floating creature as large as the Evas but lacking humanoid limbs, and instead possessing folding foil-like "arms" and a malformed "skull" as a face.

title: leliel_(evangelion)
body:
The twelfth [[Angel (evangelion)|]] from [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]].

It initially appears as a large, floating, black-and-white patterned sphere, and, when attacked, it re-manifests as a large black shadow. The Angel's true body is the shadow itself, and the "shadow" of the Angel is the floating sphere.

title: sahaquiel_(evangelion)
body: The tenth [[Angel (evangelion)|]] in [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]]. A massive and bizarrely-shaped creature. It has an elongated body, with three eye-like markings (one in the center and one on either end of the body), and three stem-like growths projecting radially at both ends.

title: sandalphon_(evangelion)
body: [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]] character. The eighth [[Angel (evangelion)|]], is similar in form to a flatfish, but with two arm-like appendages and two knobs on its "top" side.

title: gaghiel_(evangelion)
body: The sixth [[Angel (evangelion)|]] in [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]]. An aquatic being with a massive body and long jaws filled with sharp teeth.

title: ramiel_(evangelion)
body:
The fifth [[Angel (evangelion)|]] from [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]].

It is a hollow, translucent blue octahedron. It bears an [[AT field]] so powerful that it visibly warps light passing through it.

Best known for its agonizing "scream" emitting when it deploys its AT field.

title: israfel_(evangelion)
body: The seventh [[Angel (evangelion)|]] from [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]], Israfel has the appearance of a massive, vaguely humanoid creature, similar to [[Sachiel (evangelion)|]]. Israfel's most notable weapon is its ability to split itself into separate, twin Angels.

title: e16a_zuiun
body:
The [b]Aichi E16A[/b] [i]Zuiun[/i] (Allied [i]Paul[/i]) was a reconnaissance [[seaplane]] operated by the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] during [[World War II]].

The Zuiun had a single wing and was equipped with twin floats. It also featured dive brakes, which allowed it to operate as a dive bomber. It was developed fairly late in the war, and was notably flown from the aviation battleships [[ise_(battleship)|Ise]] and [[hyuuga_(battleship)|Hyuuga]].

h4. See also
* [[Aichi E13A]] (its immediate predecessor)

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Aichi E16A":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aichi_E16A]

title: mitsubishi_f1m_pete
body:
Also known as the [b]Navy Type Zero Observation Seaplane[/b] (not to be confused with the [[Aichi E13A|Type Zero Reconnaissance Seaplane]]), the [b]Mitsubishi F1M[/b] was the last [[biplane]] of the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] to have been produced.

Originally intended (and used) as a ship-based recon seaplane, it also served in other roles such as anti-submarine and anti-shipping. The F1M also served with Indonesia post-war. Its Allied codename was [b]Pete[/b].

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Mitsubishi F1M":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mitsubishi_F1M]

title: aichi_e13a
body:
Also known as the [b]Navy Type Zero Reconnaissance Seaplane[/b] (not to be confused with the [[Mitsubishi F1M Pete|Type Zero Observation Seaplane]]), the [b]Aichi E13A[/b] was the most numerous ship-launched recon seaplane of the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]].

Entering service with the Japanese in mid-1941, it saw widespread service through the war in varying roles beyond reconnaissance and served with the French and Chinese post-war.

h4. See also
* [[E16A Zuiun|Aichi E16A]] (improvement of the E13A with dive-bombing capabilities)

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Aichi E13A":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aichi_E13A]

title: g_gundam
body:
[b]Kidou Butouden G Gundam[/b], known as [b]Mobile Fighter G Gundam[/b] in the west, is an original 49 episode anime series created by [[Sunrise (company)|]] that originally aired from 1994 to 1995. Several manga and light novels were also created based on the series after the anime airing.

Unlike any other [[Gundam]] series, G Gundam is a [[Super Robot]] series to the core, with special moves, calling attacks, extreme ranges of emotion, and quite possibly the most diverse menagerie of Gundam designs in any series.

h4. See also

title: nanto_bakusatsu_ken
body:
Lit. "South Star Exploding Fist"

A "martial art style" from [[Hokuto no Ken]] consisting of throwing [[dynamite]]. It was "practiced" by Jackal, one of the minor villains of the series.

Several other bizarre "martial art" styles were labelled as "Nanto Seiken" variants by their users (including but not limited to: [[nanto ningen hodan|human cannonballs]], absurdly long polearms, and playing cards), making Nanto Bakusatsu Ken a running gag of the series.

Best summed up by Jackal's iconic quote: "Hey, as long as it works."

title: nanto_ningen_hodan
body:
Lit. "South Star Human Cannonball"

A "martial art style" from [[Hokuto no Ken]] consisting of [i]literally[/i] shooting the "practitioner" from a large [[cannon]] as projectile. It was "practiced" by the Gold Wolf gang, one of the anime filler villains of the series.

As with [[Nanto Bakusatsu Ken]], it was one of the several bizarre (and probably self-proclaimed) "Nanto Seiken" variants. Making it a running gag of the series.

title: golden_frieza
body:
A new form of the [[Frieza Clan]] created and named by [[Frieza]] himself, after being revived in [[Dragon Ball Z Fukkatsu no F]] and in its [[Dragon Ball Super]] adaptation. Appearance is identical to their clan's final form, but their white skin mainly turns gold and some minor changes which varies depending on the user (ex. some body parts turning purple, purple gem-like parts either disappearing or changing size and shape, etc.), the gold initially serving to mock Super Saiyan before retroactively being themed after the gold seen in credit card levels.

Unlike the Frieza Clan's previous forms, which are for power suppression (with their Final Form being their true form), the Golden Frieza form is a temporary, power up form similar to the [[Super Saiyan]] forms.

title: nani_ga_warui
body:
Song of the third ending of the [[Bocchi the Rock!]] anime. Sung by Suzushiro Sayumi, [[voice actor|seiyuu]] of [[Ijichi Nijika]].

The anime ending is most notable for "a scene":[https://youtu.be/3ijkvUYwJhU?t=56], in which a [[chibi]]fied [[Kita Ikuyo]] raises either her thumb or index finger (the latter according to "the animation director":[https://twitter.com/suzukiharuka0_0/status/1603040059959091202]). However, due to the nature of chibi hands, it is frequently interpreted as [[middle finger]], resulting in a lot of fan art of Kita flipping off the audience.

h4. External links

* "Ikuyo Kita's Middle Finger / Omnidirectional Middle Finger | Know Your Meme":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/ikuyo-kitas-middle-finger-omnidirectional-middle-finger]

title: honey_come_chatka!!
body:
Lasting from 2016 to 2020, [b]Honey Come Chatka!![/b] was a (largely) [[4koma]]-based series by [[bkub]], on Kodansha's "Twi4" (Twitter 4-koma) online publication via Twitter and the Saizensen website of the main subsidiary involved, Seikaisha Comics.

It follows the titular Honey Come Chatka idol group, consisting of [[Komikado Sachi]], [[Tayo]] and [[DJ Copy and Paste]], alongside their manager [[Amane (honey_come_chatka!!)|]]. In addition, it follows their super-fans [[Chakapi]] and [[Calimero (honey_come_chatka!!)|]] on the B-sides of each 4koma.

Lasted for three volumes.

title: tsubaki_(senran_kagura)
body:
A playable character from the [[Senran Kagura]] video game series. She makes her debut in [[Senran Kagura New Wave]]. The only daughter of an old Japanese inn. A strong independent spirit, in order to live alone she beat the gate of Saint Venus. Bands, ninjas, if it's the means of living alone she'll consider it. Also, she's not the type to choose one occupation, but will occasionally pick the wrong type of job.

She uses sound-based hand-to-hand combat using special wrist guards

title: rasengan
body:
lit. Spiraling Sphere

A blue ball of spiraling energy, based on Kitsune-bi(or Fox-fire).

A powerful (though incomplete) A-rank ninjitsu technique created by [[Namikaze Minato]], and the signature attack of [[Uzumaki Naruto]], as well as mastered by [[Jiraiya (naruto)|]], [[Hatake Kakashi]], and [[Sarutobi Konohamaru]]. They are many variations of the tecnique, including a larger size, and a wind element version.

Not to be confused with regular [[energy ball]], or regular [[hitodama]]. Tag is used when said energy ball is shoved onto the person's gut, or if the tags indicate it.

title: g_compatible_kaiser
body:
The combination of [[Compatible Kaiser]] and [[G Thunder Gate]] 
With the G Thundergate transformed into a giant Wing Booster, the Kaiser gains a great amount of mobility boost. The Thunder Smasher weapon on the G Thundergate is also now available as Kaiser's Shoulder Cannons. With both OG (Over Gate) Engines combined together, the power output of G Compatible Kaiser has also been increased many folds and allows it to finally use the Over Kaiser Sword that it was unable to call forth while it was in its previous form. However, due to the difference in technologies used to repair the Compatible Kaiser (Earth Technology by Kisaburo Azuma) and G Thundergate (EOT by Dark Brain), a few problematic points have surfaced, preventing the G Compatible Kaiser from reaching its original power levels. It is unknown when, where, and by who the G Compatible Kaiser was originally created.
other_names: Gコンパチブルカイザー

title: manta_ray
body:
A very large oceangoing "ray":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Batoidea that feeds on plankton and small fish. Flat and having large "wings" like its other brethren, it sports two projections on either side of its head (called cephalic lobes) that help guide food into its mouth.

Unlike stingrays, manta rays don't have their mouths on their underside.

h4. See also

* [[fish]]
* [[stingray]]

title: viera
body:
A race of [[rabbit girl|mostly female rabbit-like]] humanoids from the Ivalice realm of the [[Final Fantasy]] series.

Predominantly a female race, male versions were revealed for the release of the [i][[Final Fantasy XIV]] Endwalker[/i] expansion.

In FF14 lore, Viera have an indeterminate gender at birth, with gender only becoming apparent at puberty. As such [[1other]] may be more applicable when tagging Viera [[child]]ren that are not otherwise specified.

title: recoil
body:
For every action, there is a reaction with an equal but opposed force. With a gun, the force that pushes the bullet foward also pushes the gun backwards, producing a kickback or recoil.

This tag is used for when recoil is portrayed in some fashion, whether it is portrayed realisticly or exaggeratedly.  Can also refer to similar phenomena not involving a firearm, such as the backlash of a released spring or other stretched object.

title: fish_pedicure
body:
Ichthyotherapy is the use of fish for cleaning skin wounds or treating other skin conditions. The name ichthyotherapy comes from the Greek name for fish – ichthys.

The most widely known form of ichthyotherapy is used in the treatment of skin conditions and involves the Garra rufa fish, commonly known as [[doctor fish]] or nibble fish.

h4. See also
* [[doctor fish]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Ichthyotherapy":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ichthyotherapy]

title: doctor_fish
body:
The [b]red garra[/b] (Garra rufa), also known as the [b]doctor fish[/b] or [i]nibble fish[/i], is a species of cyprinid. This small fish typically is up to about 14 cm in total length.

Since the early 21st century, this fish has been integrated into a [[spa]] treatment where they feed on the [i]stratum corneum[/i] skin layer of patients with [[psoriasis]]. While the doctor fish treatment has been found to alleviate the symptoms of psoriasis, the treatment is not curative, and no cure for psoriasis currently exists. 

The use of the fish as a spa treatment for the wider public is still widely debated on grounds of efficacy and validity. 

h4. See also
* [[fish pedicure]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Red garra":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_garra]

body:
A powered version of [[Sailor Chibi Moon]], prominently seen in the anime's fourth story arc when [[Helios (sailor moon)|]] grants her and [[Sailor Moon]] his power to become stronger. Chibi Moon uses the Crystal Carillon to summon Pegasus with the spell Twinkle Yell. She has more attacks in the manga, usually teaming up with Sailor Moon for double attacks. title: phoenix_wright:_ace_attorney_-_spirit_of_justice
body:
The sixth installment of the [[Ace Attorney]] series that takes place in a mysterious country named Khura'in, which has heavy spiritual connections. A new gameplay element called Divination Seances is introduced, where the final moments of the victim's life can be scrutinized against evidence in the trial.

Half of the game takes place in Khura'in with [[Phoenix Wright]] as the attorney, while the other half takes place back home with [[Apollo Justice]] and [[Athena Cykes]] as the attorneys.

title: hanzo_(overwatch)
body:
[i]"With every death comes honor. With honor, redemption."[/i]

Real Name: Hanzo Shimada
Age: 38
Occupation: Mercenary, Assassin
Country: Japan

A damage-class character in [[Overwatch]]. As the new successor to the Shimada Clan, Hanzo was instructed by the clan elders to straighten out his younger brother [[genji_(overwatch)|Genji]]. Genji refused to take part in the family business, however, and Hanzo was forced to kill him. This act broke Hanzo's heart, and drove him to abandon the clan as he hones his skills to restore his honor.

title: kamen_rider_buffa
body:
One of the Kamen Riders in [[Kamen Rider Geats (series)|Kamen Rider Geats]]. Patterned after a buffalo.

[[Azuma Michinaga]] is a hard-nosed blue-collar worker and veteran of the Desire Grand Prix. His brash attitude, loner behavior and vitriol towards other Kamen Riders fuel his relentlessness in combat, while also putting him at constant odds with the comparatively frivolous and eccentric [[Kamen Rider Geats|Geats]].
other_names: 仮面ライダーバッファ

It is mostly colored white and has a sleeker design than the [[Mobilesuit Beta]].

title: kamen_rider_na-go
body:
One of the Kamen Riders in [[Kamen Rider Geats (series)|Kamen Rider Geats]]. Patterned after a cat. 

[[Kurama Neon]] is a famous internet personality and the wealthy heiress to the Kurama Conglomerate, yet her free-spirited personality clashes with her mother's controlling tendencies. She chooses to join the Desire Grand Prix as a way to be free, and her cutesy demeanor in no way hinders her abilities as a strong fighter and resolve towards achieving her goal of finding true love.

title: kamen_rider_tycoon
body:
One of the Kamen Riders in [[Kamen Rider Geats (series)|Kamen Rider Geats]]. Patterned after a tanuki.

[[Sakurai Keiwa]] is an idealistic yet clumsy young man, trying his best to get by in life. After accepting an invitation to join the Desire Grand Prix to protect his sister, Keiwa puts all his efforts towards striving for his ideal peaceful world where everyone can be happy.
other_names: 仮面ライダータイクーン

title: mazda_rx-vision
body:
A concept [[sports car]]  presented by [[Mazda]] in 2015 as a potential future return to rotary-engined performance cars. Styled as a modern successor to the [[Mazda RX-7|RX-7]] and [[Mazda RX-8|RX-8]].

While a car based on the concept has yet to enter production, a GT3 spec [[racecar]] variant of the RX-Vision made a playable appearance in the 2020 installment of [[Gran Turismo]].

title: mazda_rx-7_fd
body:
The third and final generation of the [[Mazda RX-7]], produced from 1992 to 2002 and sold in America from 1993 to 1995. This generation is the most recognizable of the series and is often considered one of [[Mazda]]'s best cars.

The FD was prominently featured in [[Initial D]], where [[Takahashi Keisuke]] drives a [[Takahashi Keisuke's Mazda rx-7 fd|personalized model]], and a heavily modified model also appears in [[The Fast and The Furious: Tokyo Drift]] as Han's main car.

body:

title: htol#niq:_hotaru_no_nikki
body:
A 2014 video game created by Japanese game developer Nippon Ichi Software for the PlayStation Vita. The game follows the story of a young amnesiac girl named Mion who wakes up at the bottom level of dark underground ruins. The firefly Hotaru ends up meeting Mion. Wanting to help Mion escape the ruins and see the outside world, the firefly begins a journey leading Mion out of the ruins.

h4. Characters

title: cardfight!!_vanguard
body:
A Japanese trading card game and media franchise created by [[Bushiroad]]. It was first released in 2011.

Though the franchise initially enjoyed success, it suffered from overbloated release owning to the game's critical flaws of restricted "Clan" deckbuilding. The game received a reboot in 2021 known as [[cardfight!!_vanguard:_overdress|Overdress]].

title: my_singing_monsters
body: My Singing Monsters is a 2012 video game & virtual band franchise developed by Big Blue Bubble and published by Canada Media Fund. The first game of the series was released on September 4, 2012, for Apple iOS. Ports of the game for other operating systems were later released, including versions for Android, Amazon Kindle Fire, Barnes & Noble Nook, and Steam. The game was also released on the PlayStation Vita portable console. Since its release, My Singing Monsters has grown into a multimedia franchise, with a prequel, several spin-off games, books, live events and series, and a board game. On May 12, 2021, Big Blue Bubble announced that the series would be releasing its first console title, My Singing Monsters: Playground, on November 9, 2021.

title: nepheli_loux
body:
[b]Nepheli Loux[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. She is the adopted daughter of [[Gideon Ofnir]]. The [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]] meets her first within Stormveil Castle. Should the they choose to, she becomes the next ruler of Stormveil Castle and Limgrave. She is presumed to be a descendant of [[Godrey First Elden Lord|]], when he was still named [[Hoarah Loux]].

[spoiler]The Tarnished can also choose to turn her into their personal puppet.[/spoiler]

title: rennala's_student
body:
[b]Rennala's Students[/b] are enemies in [[Elden Ring]]. They are only found in the grand library of Raya Lucaria, with [[Rennala Queen of the Full Moon]], and act as enemies during the fight against her. These juvenile girls wear the dark blue and red robes and crawl carrying a candle stand, from which they can spew fire. 

It's clear they are malformed from the imperfect process of rebirth, with their lower half of their bodies twisted. They appear to have diminished mental faculties and serve as a minor nuisance.

title: twin_maiden_husks
body: [b]The Twin Maiden Husks[/b] are characters in [[Elden Ring]]. They a set of [[Palm Reader (elden ring)|]] twins found at the Roundtable hold that sells the [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]] various items and weapons. The Tarnished the give them Bell Bearings, expanding their inventory of sold items, as well as allowing the Tarnished to get items they've missed from death NPCs.

title: spacesuit
body: A special garment encompassing the whole body to keep the wearer safe from the rigours of outer space (vacuum, temperature, radiation, and so on). Space suits in sci-fi settings are usually much less bulky than those IRL.

title: palm_reader_(elden_ring)
body: [b]Palm Readers[/b], or Finger Reader Crones, are characters found in [[Elden Ring]]. They are old, dried up, crones with a staff and enlarged heads found sitting at various locations in the world, beckoning the [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]] to let them read their fingers. They resemble [[Finger Reader Enia]].

title: primeval_sorcerer_azur
body:
[b]Primeval Sorcerer Azur[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. He is one of the founding members of Raya Lucaria and can be found, barely able to move from the glintstone sprouting from his body, at Mount Gelmir, where he gives the player his signature spell Comet Azur. Azur wears dark ragged robes and cloak with aquamarine glintstone growing from the shoulders. He has a large piece of glintstone growing from his head, partially wrapped in bandages, as his brain has transformed into that mineral.

[spoiler]Getting Comet Azur from Azur is a requirement to start [[Sorceress Sellen]]'s questline.[/spoiler]

title: primeval_sorcerer_lusat
body:
[b]Primeval Sorcerer Lusat[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. He is one of the founding members of Raya Lucaria and wears dark ragged robes and cloak with deep blue glintstone growing from the shoulder and neck. His head has a large glintstone eye growing on top of it, partially wrapped in bandages, as his brain is turning into glintstone. The large eye resembles the eye embedded within the skulls of [[Astel Naturalborn of the Void]] and [[Fallingstar Beast]].

[spoiler]Lusat is part of [[Sorceress Sellen]]'s questline where she asks the [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]] to locate his body. Upon finding him, he will give the Tarnished his signarture spell - Stars of Ruin.[/spoiler]

title: fia_the_deathbed_companion
body:
[b]Fia, the Deathbed Companion[/b], is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. She is one of the notable [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]] mentioned in the introduction of the game, a [[necrophilia|deathbed companion]], and one of Those Who Live in Death. She is found inside a small [[bedroom]] in a certain location in the game, and associated with a side-story in the game. Interacting with her allows her to [[hug]] the Tarnished and let them rest a moment [spoilers]in exchange for 5% maximum HP and a consumable item[/spoilers].

Interestingly, she has fully modeled legs and sexy [[panties]] (Deathbed Smalls, See Post #5171632) underneath her [[robe]]. [spoiler]If the player obtains this armor item through being dropped by another in co-op, they will be banned from online permanently, as there is no legit way to get it without hacking the game[/spoiler]

[spoilers]Progression in her side-story is required to face [[Lichdragon Fortissax]].

title: bloody_finger_hunter_yura
body:
[b]Bloody Finger Hunter Yura[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. He wears a large metal hat and a combination of leather and steel armor, and wields the absurdly long katana, Nagakiba, a [[nodachi]]. His design resembles that of a stereotypical ronin, with the large straw hat. As his name implies, he hunts Blood Fingers, servants of [[Mohg Lord of Blood]]. The [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]] can take up his quest and help him slay Bloody Fingers.

[spoiler]After his death during the end of his questline, his body is then possessed by [[Shabriri (elden ring)|]][/spoiler]

title: vargram_the_raging_wolf
body:
[b]Vargram the Raging Wolf[/b] is a character and optional enemy in [[Elden Ring]]. He wears the Raging Wolf armor set, worn by the [[Bloody Wolf (elden ring)|]] class, and carries a great sword.

[spoiler]Vargram is one of the paired assassination targets, along with [[Errant Sorcerer Wilhelm]], given to the Tarnished as a part of [[Bernahl (elden ring)|]]'s side quest in Volcano Manor[spoiler]

title: errant_sorcerer_wilhelm
body:
[b]Errant Sorcerer Wilhelm[/b] is a character and optional enemy in [[Elden Ring]]. Wilhelm is a mage with a Raya Lucarian stone crown with a red blindfold, and a reddish-brown robe. 

[spoiler]He is one of the paired assassination targets, along with [[Vargram the Raging Wolf]], that is given to the [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]] by [[Bernahl (elden ring)|]] for his optional quest in Volcano Manor.[/spoiler]

title: ensha_of_the_royal_remains
body:
[b]Ensha of the Royal Remains[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. He wears the Royal Remains set, a black armor that looks like its been rotting, revealing the human skeleton within. When the [[Tarnished (elden ring)]] first enters the Roundtable Hold, he can be found leaning against the wall outside [[Gideon Ofnir]]'s room. Later he will invade the Tarnish as they fast-travel to Roundtable Hold and must be fought. Ensha is in allegiance with Gideon. 

[spoiler]Speaking to him while in Roundtable Hold will grant the player the "What are you looking at?" gesture. Defeating him will give the Tarnished his armor set and weapon[/spoiler]

title: rileigh_the_idle
body: [b]Rileigh the Idle[/b] in a character and optional enemy in [[Elden Ring]]. He wears a the black hooded armor set of the [[Confessor (elden ring)|]] and wields a crossbow and dagger that applies [[Scarlet Rot]]. The [[Tarnished (elden ring)]] is assigned to assassinate him as a part of the Volcano Manor questline.

title: blasphemous_blade
body: [b]The Blasphemous Blade[/b] is the legendary remembrance weapon in [[Elden Ring]] the [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]] can obtain after defeating [[Rykard Lord of Blasphemy]] and trading in his soul. It's the sword Rykard pulls out of his mouth during his second phase, with the ability to unleash a powerful wave of fire that heals the Tarnished on hit and kill.

title: commoner_(elden_ring)
body: [b]Commoners[/b] are recurring enemies in [[Elden Ring]]. They are lanky emaciated corpse-like humans, and often found sitting about. Commoners wear weathered white robes,  a black headband, and carry a short sword. Some will throw explosive pots at the [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]], that can detonate barrels.

title: royal_revenant_(elden_ring)
body:
[b]Royal Revenants[/b] are a minor boss and rare enemies in [[Elden Ring]]. These large undead creatures have multiple pairs of arms and legs, hidden by their ragged cloak, given them a human-centipede like appearance. Their attacks are fast, persistent, and they can disappear into the ground and reappear under you or spew deadly poison.

[spoiler]Using any AOE healing spell near them will not only deal massive damage, but also stun them for a riposte[/spoiler]

title: kerosene_heater
body:
A type of [[heater|space heater]] that burns kerosene to generate heat.  Traditional models commonly appears as either cylindrical with a wire guard or rectangular with a small can-shaped wick cover inside.  Many types of these heaters do not require electricity and make them ideal for places that might not have access to electricity or where electricity could be lost for long periods of time during the winter.  They're a common type of space heater in Japan.

These heaters get very hot on the top and are commonly used as stoves, though not all designs are intentionally intended to be used as one.

For tagging purposes this tag should not be used for more modern designs that require electricity to operate, as they may not be visibly distinguishable from some types of electric heaters.

h4. See Also

* "Wikipedia - kerosene heater":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kerosene_heater]

title: amy_third_sister
body: [b]Amy Third Sister[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. She is one of the 5 'rot sisters', including [[Millicent (elden ring)|]], [[Mary Eldest Sister]], [[Maureen Second Sister]] and [[Polyanna Youngest Sister]]. Amy wears the same robes as the other sisters, and dual swords two curved swords.

title: maureen_second_sister
body: [b]Maureen Second Sister[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. She is one of the 5 'rot sisters', including [[Millicent (elden ring)|]], [[Mary Eldest Sister]], [[Amy Third Sister]] and [[Polyanna Youngest Sister]]. Maureen wears the same robes as the other sisters, and wields a golden great spear.

title: mary_eldest_sister
body: [b]Mary Eldest Sister[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. She is one of the 5 'rot sisters', including [[Millicent (elden ring)|]], [[Maureen Second Sister]], [[Amy Third Sister]] and [[Polyanna Youngest Sister]]. Mary wears the same robes as the other sisters, and wields a halo scythe used by the [[Cleanrot Knight]]s.

title: lhutel_the_headless
body:
[b]Lhutel the Headless[/b] is a spirit ash in [[Elden Ring]]. She is a Mausoleum Knight, and like all of them, has been decapitated. She wears the dark grey Mausoleum knight armor, carries a great shield and a lance. She pokes with, or throws, her spear. Her weapon is enchanted with the Deathblight, but the effect is useless against most enemies.

[spoiler]With the ability to teleport, she is very agile and good at staying alive, but not so good at holding enemy aggro. Each time she fades away, it resets the enemy's target back to the [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]].[/spoiler]

title: chevron_(symbol)
body:
A chevron is a V-shaped mark seen on flags, badges, and logos.

h1. See also
* [[Chevron Corporation]]
* [[tag group:symbols]]

title: bloody_finger_nerijus
body: [b]Bloody Finger Nerijus[/b] is a character and enemy in [[Elden Ring]]. He is likely to be the first NPC invader the [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]] will encounter. He wears a black hooded robe and wields a unique blood dagger. [[Bloody Finger Hunter Yura]] will appear and help the Tarnished fight him; afterwhich you can start his quest.

title: banished_knight_oleg
body: [b]Banished Knight Oleg[/b] is a spirit ash found in [[Elden Ring]], within the Fringefolk Hero's Grave. He is the reward for defeating the [[Ulcerated Tree Spirit]]. Like other [[Banished Knight]]s, Oleg wears heavy steel armor. He wields a pair of great swords and has various slashing and leaping attacks.

title: bernahl_(elden_ring)
body: [b]Bernahl[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. The [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]] can first meet him in a wooden shack in Limgrave, where he sells you various weapon skills. He is later found as a member of the Volcano Manor, a recusant. Bernahl has silvery armor engraved with various bestial motifs, and a large pole mace.

h6. Disambiguation
* [[anatomy]]

title: school_of_graven_mages
body: [b]School of Graven Mages[/b] are rare enemies found in [[Elden Ring]]. They look like large spheres made up of the various stone crowns from the schools of magic in Raya Lucaria, compressed into a ball. They have various magic attacks, including a deadly mist.

title: mazinger_z_infinity
body: A fictional [[super robot]] from the [[Mazinger Z: Infinity]] [[science fiction]] anime film from 2018.

title: omenkiller_(elden_ring)
body: [b]Omen Killers[/b] are minor bosses or rare enemies found in [[Elden Ring]]. These large brutish warriors wield dual stony blades line with protruding horns. They wear a spikey stone mask and thick draping leather armor and cloak.

title: imp_(elden_ring)
body:
[b]Imps[/b] are common enemies in [[Elden Ring]]. These small animated stone creatures come with various heads. Most of them wield hooked forks, while others carry great swords. They are usually found in catacombs, although occasionally they can be found in the world.

Many of them throw exploding pots or kukris. Since their weapons cause bleed, they can be quite deadly, despite their size. That and their tendency to lie in ambush or their darting attacks makes them very annoying to fight, especially when there are more than one.

title: golem_(elden_ring)
body:
[b]Golems[/b] are minor bosses and rare enemies in [[Elden Ring]]. They are gigantic stone humanoids with a burning furnace inside their chests. One variant has a giant bow, while the other a giant halberd. Both can spew fire from their chest. Some have armored ankles that makes from more resilient against being knocked over.

[spoiler]There is a secret magic Golem just above the arena where [[Starscourge Radahn]] is that is arguably harder them most bosses in the game. It has various unique magical attacks and a huge life pool. No unique rewards are given, and the runes it drops is miniscule[/spoiler]

title: banished_knight
body: [b]Banished Knights[/b] are enemies found in [[Elden Ring]]. They have heavy steel armor and are found wielding various weapons - dual swords, a halberd or a shield and sword. They can summon a vortex of wind (varies depending on their weapons) and leap at the [[Tarnished]] in combat. Later variants can be found wearing a red cloak around their helmet. The cloaked ones are presumably in allegiance with the Ancient Dragons, as they gain a fire incantation in addition to their usual attacks.

title: leonine_misbegotten
body: [b]Leonine Misbegotten[/b] are a minor boss, and later tough enemies, in [[Elden Ring]]. They are large anthropomorphized lion-like humanoids with a bright orange-red mangey main and a large iron great sword.

title: grafted_scion
body: [b]Grafted Scions[/b] are minor bosses, and later tough enemies, in [[Elden Ring]]. They are spider-like creatures created from a child (albeit a large one) grafted with various limbs and body parts. They hold golden shields and a pair of golden swords covered in a large embroidered cloak, bearing some resemblance to [[Godrick the Grafted]].

title: godskin_noble
body:
[b]Godskin Nobles[/b] are minor bosses found in [[Elden Ring]]. They wear white leathery armor made of stitched skin that make them look fat. They wield a large thrusting sword and have a serpent-like tail. These enemies wield the power of Black Flame, like their other kindred. Despite their apparent size, they are very agile and fast to attack.

[spoiler]Gitgud and learn to roll, or find a suitable obstacle, when they start snowballing with their roll attack[/spoiler]

title: fallingstar_beast
body: [b]Fallingstar Beasts[/b] are minor bosses and field bosses in [[Elden Ring]]. They roughly resemble a large cow-like creature with obsidian skin and a humanoid skull buried inside their encased heads containing a large jewel-like eye. Falling star beasts are celestial creatures that fell onto the Lands Between from the heavens. Like all stellar monstrosities, they attack with gravity magic, or with charges and lunges. The Fallingstar beasts are believed to be the larval forms of the [[Astel Naturalborn of the Void]].

title: dragonkin_soldier
body: [b]Dragonkin Soldiers[/b] are minor bosses found in [[Elden Ring]]. They are gigantic humanoids with a reptilians head and hollowed out abdomens, like the [[Troll (elden Ring)|]]s. Their skin are stony, shriveled, dried and decaying. These creatures are born from the attempts of humans to become dragons, but falling sort and not quite able to attain the dragons' immortality.

title: death_rite_bird
body:
[b]Death Rite Birds[/b] are field bosses found in [[Elden Ring]]. These giant undead bird-like enemies only spawn at night in various locations of the world and are a more powerful variant of the lesser [[Deathbird (elden ring)|]]s. The creature resemble lanky humanoids with a humanoid skull and a bird-like beak. Their bodies are embedded with various corpses, have spindly arms, legs and large ghostly black wings. They also wield a large crooked sword. 

They have various magical attacks they they can unleash from their weapon or wings, as well as various melee attacks. Defeating one will reward the [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]] with various weapons, spells or incantations.

title: fire_emblem_gaiden
body:
The second installment in the [[Fire Emblem]] series, released for the [[Famicom]] only in Japan.

A remake, [[Fire Emblem Echoes: Shadows of Valentia]], was released on the [[Nintendo 3DS]] in 2017.
other_names: ファイアーエムブレム外伝

title: commander_niall_(elden_ring)
body:
[b]Commander Niall[/b] is a boss in [[Elden Ring]]. He is found in the Castle Sol, on The Mountaintop of the Giants. Like [[Commander O'neil]], this boss wears heavy armor with a furry cloak and wields a standard as his main weapon. Unlike O'Neil, Niall has a bladed prosthetic leg as his other weapon. Niall will summon two ghostly Banished Knight spirits at the beginning; one with dual swords, and the other with a shield and sword. His attacks are either frost or lightning based.

[spoiler]Defeating Commander Niall will allow the player to get the second half of the secret Haligtree medallion[/spoiler]

title: vine_(company)
body: A now-defunct video sharing service owned by Twitter with a 6-second limit on video length, most well-known for its [[meme]]s.

title: sand_guardian_(meme)
body:
A [[vine_(company)|vine]] featuring a man buried to his head in a pile of [[sand]], telling the ocean to fuck off.

h4. External links
* "Know Your Meme":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/sand-guardian]

title: giant_crow_(elden_ring)
body:
[b]Giant Crows[/b] are giant creatures found in [[Elden Ring]]. These huge t-rex-like birds are extremely aggressive and will chase the [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]] a long distance, and can outpace a sprinting [[Torrent (elden ring)|]]. They also have the nasty habit to feign being stunned. 

Two varieties are found in the game, the usual black variety, and the bloody varient found in [[Mohg Lord of Blood]]'s Palace.

title: giant_crayfish_(elden_ring)
body:
[b]Giant Crayfish[/b] are powerful enemies found in [[Elden Ring]]. These gigantic crustaceans have one large pincer, while the other arm has evolved into being more lance-like for stabbing. They have the tendency to spit jets of slime with deadly accuracy from long range, earning them the moniker: "Sniper Lobsters". 

These creatures come in two varieties - earthy greenish brown ones found in Liurnia of the Lakes, or the icey blue ones found in the Mountaintop of the Giants.

[spoiler]Ones with glowing red eyes have a second phase where they transform into a [[Grafted Scion]][/spoiler]

title: fire_prelate
body: [b]Fire Prelates[/b] are powerful enemies found in [[Elden Ring]]. These large enemies wear silvery armor that resemble fat men with a large candle stand on their heads, from which they spew fire. They come in two variants, one wearing a red surcoat wields a thorny whip, while the other one without it has a large maul. Fire Prelates are in league with the [[Fire Giant (elden ring)|]]s and in service of the [b]Fell God[/b].

title: ulcerated_tree_spirit
body: [b]Ulcerated Tree Spirits[/b] are minor bosses and field bosses found in [[Elden Ring]]. These salamander-shaped creatures are covered in bark and pulsating flesh littered with blisters and ulcers. They slither and undulate about and come in two variants - golden or rotten. Both attack with wild swings, leaps, and pounces, and spew a breath attack matching their element.

title: tree_sentinel
body:
[b]Tree Sentinels[/b] are minor field bosses found in [[Elden Ring]]. They [[horseback riding|ride]] on large [[horse]]s, wielding a [[gold|golden]] [[halberd]] and [[shield]]. Both the Tree Sentinel and the horse wear [[gold armor|gold]], [[full armor|full]] [[plate armor]].

[spoiler]Unlike all other mounted knights found in the field, Tree Sentinels cannot be dismounted because they are chained to their mounts.[/spoiler]

title: tibia_mariner
body:
[b]Tibia Mariners[/b] are minor field bosses found in [[Elden Ring]]. They are giant ghostly skeleton spirits that carry a long horn and rides a boat carried by ghostly water. They are able to summon undead minions, including skeleton spearman or giant spirit skeletons, in addition to attack the [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]] with their horn or boat.

[spoiler]Defeating one will reward the player with a Deathroot quest item, in addition to various other weapons and spirit ashes. There are a total of 4 Tibia Mariners.[/spoiler]

title: magma_wyrm_(elden_ring)
body:
[b]Magma Wyrms[/b] are bosses found in [[Elden Ring]]. They are gigantic towering lizards with stout arms and legs, carrying a large black scaly curved sword and spews magma from their mouth.

[spoiler]Magma Wyrms were once human, whose transformed into the giant lizard after consuming too many dragon hearts.[/spoiler]

title: smithing_master_hewg
body: [b]Smithing Master Hewg[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. He is the Misbegotten blacksmith the [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]] meets [b]inside Roundtable Hold[/b].

title: emanuella_porlallora
other_names: エマヌエーラ・ポルラローラ

title: lady_tanith_(elden_ring)
body: [b]Lady Tanith[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. Tanith offers the [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]] to join the Volcano Manor when they first meet. She is the matron of the Volcano Manor, ally and presumably consort to [[Rykard Lord of Blasphemy]], in his war against the [[Erdtree (elden ring)|]]. Tanith is also the adoptive mother to [[Rya (elden ring)|]]. She wears white robes with a copper and silvery mask.

title: jar_bairn
body:
[b]Jar Bairn[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. They are a unique, small [[Living Jar (elden ring)|]] that the [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]] can meet.

[spoiler]Jar Bairn can be found stuffing the remains of [[Diallos (elden ring)|]] inside themselves after his death, adopting Diallos' family motto.[/spoiler]

title: inquisitor_ghiza
body:
[b]Inquisitor Ghiza[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. He is found in the second floor dining hall of the [b]Volcano Manor[/b] and invades the [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]] when they first step foot there. He carries a large wheel weapon - an arm of the wheeled variant of an [[Abductor Virgin]]. He wears robes with a bandaged face, arms, and legs.

[spoiler]Defeating him will reward the Tarnished with his weapon (also known as the "Pizza Cutter" given its shape and spinning attack).[spoiler]

title: gowry_(elden_ring)
body:
[b]Gowry[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. He is a sage found in a wooden hut guarded by a giant dog in Caelid, just outside [b]Selia, Town of Sorcery[/b] He wears a faded red robe with a pointy hood. Goqry offers the [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]] the secrets of Selia in exchange for them retrieving the [b]Golden Needle[/b], and helping [[Millicent]] on her quest. Completing various parts of his quest will allow the player to buy spells and incantations from him, in additional to other rewards.

[spoiler]The human form Gowry takes is an illusion. He's is actually a [[Kindred of Rot]], or some entity that possess one. Killing him will reveal his true form, but he respawns and states his true self is elsewhere.[/spoiler]

title: cuckoo_knight
body:
[b]Cuckoo Knights[/b] are enemies in [[Elden Ring]]. They are found in the Liurnia of the Lakes region, in the service of [b]Raya Lucaria[/b]. The Cuckoo Knights are mercenaries given the title of Knight by their employer, and granted some basic magic items, such as magic grease and cuckoo glintstone. 

They are encased in the typical Elden Ring knight armor, bearing the colors and banner of Raya Lucaria, wielding a great shield and great sword. Some of them can be found mounting a large horse, wielding a partisan. Despite being in the service of Raya Lucaria, these enemies aren't mages and all of their magical attacks come from the items they use rather than spells.

title: night's_cavalry
body: [b]The Night's Calvalry[/b] are enemies in [[Elden Ring]]. They are large mounted knights clad in black metal armor and wields either a halberd or flail. These enemies only spawn at night at certain locations, rewarding the player with an item if defeated.

title: loretta_knight_of_the_haligtree
body: [b]Loretta[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. She is a giant mounted knight original in service of the Carian Royal Family. Later she finds found out she's actually an [b]Albinauric[/b], the race of homunculus she's unknowingly taken part in persecuting, and leaves to join [[Miquella (elden ring)|]]'s Haligtree Knights instead, where the Albinaurics have refuge.

title: moongrum_carian_knight
body: [b]Moongrum[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. He is a knight of the Carian Royal Family and can be found guarding [[Rennala Queen of the Full Moon]] just before the [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]] gets to the grand library.

body:
梶木 (かじき - this also refers to other "billfishes":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billfish, namely the marlin, spearfish, and sailfish).

A large, fast-swimming predatory [[fish]] with a toothless upper jaw and elongated, flattened beak that resembles a [[sword]]. It is a popular food and sport fish.

body: The CT125 is a small dual-sport motorcycle manufactured by Honda. Debuting in 2020, it is the latest in a line of similar motorcycles Honda has produced since the 1960s, starting with the Super Cub-derived CT90 and continuing through the slightly more powerful CT110 (which the CT125 strongly resembles).

title: superheroine_haruhi
body:
[[Superheroine Haruhi]] is an in-story fictional character from [[Suzumiya Haruhi no Tomadoi]] based on [[Suzumiya Haruhi]]. According to Tomadoi's plot, the SOS Brigade is helping to develop a RPG-styled game and the main characters were modeled after them.

Her outfit consists in a stylized version of Kitago's female school uniform with an exposed [[midriff]], detached short sleeves, white gloves, boots, [[miniskirt]], a flared overskirt, a sleeveless top with a conspicuous oval-shaped red jewel in the middle and just over the chest and frequently depicted wielding a rapier-based sword with a conic blade.

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[blue hair]] worn in a [[double bun]] style with [[glasses]] [[eyewear on head|on her head]] styled after Optimus' eyes. She wears a [[red jacket]] over a [[white shirt|white]] [[cropped shirt]] with exposed [[midriff]], a pair of [[grey shorts]] with a [[blue belt]], and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[boots]] with [[white thighhighs]]. She wears the [[Matrix of Leadership]] as a [[necklace]] and a pair of [[blue gloves|blue]] [[fingerless gloves]]. The figure and original art picture her holding a metal [[briefcase]] with the [[autobot]] insignia on it.

title: bubbles_(angry_birds)
body:
Orange Bird is a character in the [[Angry Birds]] series of video games. He is a newer member of the Flock, the core group of birds fighting against the [[Bad Piggies]].

Within the game, Bubbles's special ability is to expands to huge size, forcefully expels all the surrounding objects.

Introduced in the "Ham'o'ween":http://angrybirds.wikia.com/wiki/Ham'o'ween chapter of [i]"Angry Birds Season":[http://angrybirds.wikia.com/wiki/Angry_Birds_Seasons][/i], Bubbles is a cheerful bird with a gigantic appetite and a sweet tooth.

Bubbles is an Oriole.

h4. External links

* "Angry Birds Wiki: Orange Bird":http://angrybirds.wikia.com/wiki/Orange_Bird

title: red_(angry_birds)
body:
Red Bird is the main protagonist in the [[Angry Birds]] series of video games. He is the leader of the Flock, the core group of birds fighting against the [[Bad Piggies]].

For the majority of the game, Red and [[Terrence_(angry_birds)|]] are the only birds with no special abilities, but rely on brute strength instead.

In the "Red's Mighty Feathers":http://angrybirds.wikia.com/wiki/Red's_Mighty_Feathers chapter, Red was given the ability to accelerate in any direction while mid-air once. This ability originally belongs to [[Chuck_(angry_birds)|]] in [i]"Angry Birds Space":[http://angrybirds.wikia.com/wiki/Angry_Birds_Space][/i].

Red is a Desert Cardinal.

h4. External links

* "Angry Birds Wiki: Red Bird":http://angrybirds.fandom.com/wiki/Red_Bird

title: siren_(borderlands)
body: In the [[Borderlands (series)|]] universe, a Siren is a woman with mystical, unknown backgrounds and incredible powers. They are distinguishable by the blue tattoos running down one half of their body. In [[Borderlands 2]], we learn that only 6 Sirens can exist in the universe at any given time. [spoiler]During the time of [[Borderlands 2]], we know of three Sirens: [[Maya_(Borderlands)|Maya]], [[lilith_(borderlands)|Lilith]] and [[angel_(borderlands)|Angel]]. The leader of the Crimson Lance, Commandent Steele, was eventually revealed as a fourth Siren. Although, she was killed at the end of the original Borderlands.[/spoiler]

title: shin_honkaku_mahou_shoujo_risuka
body:
A light novel series written by [[Nisio Isin]] and illustrated by [[Nishimura Kinu]]. It was published in "Faust":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Faust_%28magazine%29 magazine, running from December 2003 to August 2008, and was serialized into three light novel volumes published by [[Kodansha|Kodansha Limited]] from 2004 to 2007, with one chapter unreleased. A short story version was also featured in the English anthology of [i]Faust[/i] magazine.

The light novels follow [[Mizukura Risuka]], a fifth grader with [[magic]] powers, and [[Kugi Mizutaka]], a genius class representative which lofty ambitions, as they go on a "magic hunt" around Saga Prefecture in search of Risuka's father, [[Mizukura Shingo]]. They encounter Mages and battles along the way.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Shin Honkaku Mahō Shōjo Risuka":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shin_Honkaku_Mah%C5%8D_Sh%C5%8Djo_Risuka
other_names: 新本格魔法少女りすか

title: gray_fox
body:
A character from [[Metal Gear (series)]].

[[Solid Snake]]'s friend.

Real name: Frank Jaeger. 

A mercenary and former agent of U.S. Special Forces Unit FOXHOUND. Originally a child soldier, Jaeger was the only operative in FOXHOUND to achieve the codename "Fox," the unit's highest commendation, and was decorated five times.

Fox was Solid Snake's comrade-in-arms and friend during the Outer Heaven Uprising, but his loyalty to renegade commander [[Big Boss]] forced him into combat with Snake during the Zanzibar Land Disturbance. He survived his injuries following an intense battle, after which he was forcibly outfitted with a powered exoskeleton and subjected to intensive gene therapy. Fox later confronted Snake as a neutral force during the Shadow Moses Incident, in the guise of the [[Cyborg Ninja]], before dying at the hands of [[Liquid Snake]] and [[Metal Gear REX]].

""[i]Konyappi! How are my favorite Tokoyami Kenzoku doing?🌟 I'll unleash Bibi onto you if you don't watch this![/i]":[https://twitter.com/hololive_En/status/1250361032175804417]"
-[[Tokoyami Towa]], 2020

A [[demon horns|horned]] [[pet]] that spends its days complacently resting on [[Virtual YouTuber]] [[Tokoyami Towa]]'s head, that definitely is neither a [[cat]] nor a [[familiar]] (although [[Kusunoki Shio]] will argue otherwise). Towa claims it serves as a guardian to watch over her in this world. It doesn't seem to be particularly expressive, with its face perpetually stuck in a state of [[:3|0w0]]. Bibi seems to be both the name of the character and the name of the species, and they can take the form of a [[hat]], as well as a [[multiple legs|four-legged]] bean-shaped [[creature]] with multicolored neon [[claws]] and a [[demon tail]]. Alongside Towa herself, Bibi's character design can be credited to [[rurudo]].

title: mengistu_haile_mariam
body:
An Ethiopian politician who was the leader of Ethiopia from 1977 to 1991. He was the chairman of the Derg, the Communist military junta that governed Ethiopia, from 1977 to 1987, and the President of the People's Democratic Republic of Ethiopia from 1987 to 1991. 

Effectively a dictator, his rule is remembered for the following historical events: the end of the Solomonic dynasty (which had ruled since the 13th century), ending feudalism era, land redistribution, the Ethiopian Red Terror of 1977–1978, the Somalian-Ethiopian war of 1977-1978, and the 1984 famine. The Ethiopian Red Terror was a period of great political upheaval in Ethiopia that started when the Ethiopian People's Revolutionary Party known as EHAPA (by its Ethiopian acronym) ignored the invitation by Derg to join the union of socialist parties and instead made an assassination attempt on Mengistu Haile Mariam (the Chairman of Derg) in September 1976. That assassination attempt failed but it was followed by death of many Dergue supporters and ordinary citizens. 
The Red Terror was a fight for power and dominance between ERRP and MESON (from its Amharic acronym). The killings from both sides were brutal since it happened when the country was under the threat of Somalian invasion and war. Internal rebellion was not well tolerated.
other_names: メンギスツ・ハイレ・マリアム

title: zold_out
body:
A tactical gacha RPG with deckbuilding mechanics for mobile platforms and PC, developed and currently published by Hong Kong-based developer company C4Cat Entertainment, and previously published by Chinese publisher NetEase. Initially a Kickstarter project from 2017, it received an initial release in Japan as "Zold:Out～鍛冶屋の物語"[tn]"Zold:Out~A Blacksmith's Tale"[/tn] by NetEase in 2020, before shutting down in 2022. C4Cat would later release the game in Chinese in 2021, and globally (subsequently relaunching JP) in 2023.

It follows the story of two young men: a blacksmith named Helide and a merchant named Oscar. Together with Helide's mysterious maid Lorna, elven lover-of-cuteness Mamie, and later enigmatic hunter Zelena, they go from place to place gathering materials and learning new techniques, all to pull Helide's weapons shop out of bankruptcy, while unwittingly getting involved in a conspiracy that may endanger the world peace that the two young men desire to protect.

title: moire
body:
Moiré pattern

A pattern that emerges when two grids are superimposed over one another.

Examples:

* Post #1436922: [[Scan artifacts]], interference between [[halftone]] screen in the original image and scanner samples.
* Post #2558106: Resizing artifacts, interference between [[halftone]] grid and pixel grid.
* Post #2765030 (music staff), post #4309196 (fabric pattern), post #1184284 (block texture): lack of anti-[[aliasing]].
* Post #2033517 (click "view original"): intentional easter egg.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moir%C3%A9_pattern]

title: test_card
body:
A test card, also known as a test pattern, is a television signal broadcast when no program is being aired. As standard reference images, they are useful for calibrating the colors and alignment of video signals.

Television viewers from North America and Japan are most likely to be familiar with the [b]SMPTE color bars[/b], which was by far the most common test card in regions that once used the NTSC video standard.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Test card":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Test_card
* "Wikipedia: SMPTE color bars":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SMPTE_color_bars

title: silicon_creature_(blame!)
body:
One of the main (human-originated) species in [[Blame!]].

Silicon creatures are cybernetic organisms at war with the humans. One of their main traits is their emotions and temper, capables of feeling fury and curiosity. They have their own identities and personalities (even then, many are downright psychotic killing machines). Each one has its own distinctive look, but all of them are anthropomorphic, looking as females or males and often seen banded in male-female pairs.

Their Japanese name in the original manga is 珪素生物 ([i]keiso seibutsu[/i]), which is actually a general science fiction term for "Silicon-Based Life Forms":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypothetical_types_of_biochemistry#Silicon_biochemistry].

h4. Named Characters

* [[Genitarius]]

body:

A massive entity. It's really big but rather thin (at least the visible part). Has a skull-looking head with empty eye sockets and thorn-like protrusions out of its neck and shoulders. [[Blame Gakuen!]] suggests that she is female.

title: safeguard_(blame!)
body:
One of the main species in the [[Blame!]] universe.

Their behavior is akin to that of white blood cells, protecting access to the Netsphere and hunting down anyone barred from entry. However, because of interference by the [[silicon creature (blame!)|]]s, every human being in the Solar System has been barred from entry to the Netsphere and the Safeguard consider all humans to be targets.

Safeguards with higher rank have more "free will" and human appearance, but those who are not disguised as humans usually have a -|- mark on their heads.

h4. Known Safeguards

* [[Exterminator (blame!)|]]s
* [[Sanakan]]
* [[Dhomochevsky]]
* [[Iko]]

h4. See also 

* [[Authority (BLAME!)|]]
* [[Silicon creature (blame!)|]]

title: maeve_(blame!)
body: [[Silicon creature (blame!)|Silicon being]] from [[Blame!]]. Looks female and has an X-shaped scratch on her forehead. Has a psychotic demeanor and gaze (with a case of [[strabismus]]). Very long red hair.

title: authority_(blame!)
body: 統治局 [i](Touchikyoku).[/i] Also known as the Governing Authority, the Governing Agency or the Administration, depending on the translator. They would nominally be the rulers of the [[Blame!]] universe, but they are trapped in the Netsphere and are unable to regain control of the [[Safeguard (Blame!)|Safeguard]], protect humans against [[Silicon Creature (blame!)|]]s, or restrain the growth of the City unless [[Killy]] can find a human with Net Terminal Genes. The Authority's [[emblem]] usually looks like +|+.

body:
Kibasen (lit. "Cavalry Battle") is a type of [[piggyback]] riding game played by school children in Japan. The sport is commonly played during annual school [[sports festival]]s.

The game consists of teams of four players, with one player from each team riding on top of the other three players. Teams are often divided into opposing red and white factions. The goal is to knock the opposing team's rider down, or more commonly, remove their [[bandana]]. 

A two person variation, commonly called a chicken fight, involves someone riding [[piggyback]] atop another's shoulders. 

Cavalry battles and chicken fights may be played on the ground or in a [[pool]]. Although chicken fights are seen as dangerous, cavalry battles are a common staple of Japanese school [[sports festival]]s.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Chicken fight":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chicken_fight]

body: The successor to the RDA's Avatar program in the [[james cameron's avatar|Avatar series]]. Instead of being a human/[[Na'vi]] hybrid body controlled by a person remotely, they are implanted with the memories of someone that's dead. title: leia_(g_(genesis1556))
body:
One of several [[dragon girl|dragon girls]] created by [[g (genesis1556)]]. She has [[long hair|long]], [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[pink hair]], [[large breasts]], [[pink nails]], and is frequently drawn with a pink [[flower tattoo]] running up her abdomen from her left thigh to the underside of her left breast.

Her draconic traits include a long, thick [[dragon tail|tail]], two [[dragon horns|horns]] emerging from the top of her skull and curving backward, scaled “gauntlets” and “boots” covering her forearms and ankles, as well as a number of smaller scales and scale-like markings across her arms, abdomen, and legs. They are primarily black/dark grey in color, with the exception of lighter scales on the underside of her tail and pure white skin on her hands and feet.

She is the most openly sexual and flirtatious of G’s dragon girls, frequently drawn in provocative postures, and exhibits an (apparently one-sided) [[incest]]uous attraction to her brother [[rio (genesis1556)|Rio]].

title: balance_scale
body:
A device for weighing. It has a balanced beam and two pans. When the pans contain exactly the same mass, the beam is in balance. One can place an object in one pan and standard weights in the other to find what the object weighs.

Don't use the [[Libra (zodiac)|]] tag for this. That refers to the constellation and related symbology.

title: ushimaki_riko
body:
Is a female Japanese [[virtual youtuber]] belonging to the [[Idol]] Club of [[.Live]].
Personality: Riko is a member of the broadcast committee who loves [[singing]] and [[talking]]. She is a member of the equestrian club as well but has only just started and also has extremely poor motor skills. She occasionally misspeaks and uses the Kansai dialect. It might be difficult to imagine from her bright outward appearance but the truth is that she appears to have a unique hobby...
Age: 17
Debut Date:6/05/2018
Birthday: 12 May
Zodiac Sign: [[Taurus (zodiac)|]]
* "Official Twitter":https://twitter.com/UshimakiRiko
* "Youtube Page":https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCKUcnaLsG2DeQqza8zRXHiA

title: kagura_suzu_(.live)
body:
Is a Female Japanese [[virtual youtuber]] belonging to the [[Idol]] Club of [[.Live]].
Suzu is a [[serious]] and demure committee chairman of the school [[library]]. Her hobby is [[reading]] picture [[book]]s to the children in her neighborhood. She is a member of the wind and string [[instrument]]s club and plays the [[violin]]. Her special skill seems to be [[biting]] into a whole [[lemon]]...

title: yojouhan_shinwa_taikei
body:
(4½ Tatami Mythological Chronicles, also known in English as the Tatami Galaxy)

Yojouhan Shinwa Taikei is a Japanese novel by [[Morimi Tomihiko]], originally published in December 2004 as a tankoubon and later re-published in March 2008 a bunkoban. It was adapted into an anime television series by Madhouse and began airing on Fuji TV's Noitamina programming block on April 22, 2010.

Both the novel and anime series detail the exploits of the unnamed protagonist who struggles to find a girlfriend by joining multiple college circles.

h4. Characters

* [[Watashi (yojouhan)|]], the protagonist
* [[Ozu (Yojouhan)|Ozu]], the protagonist's ostensible friend
* [[Akashi (Yojouhan)|Akashi]], a freshman at the protagonist's university
* [[Higuchi Seitarou]], a supposed Shinto deity who lives in the protagonist's dorm
* [[Jougasaki Masaki]], a popular eighth year student
* [[Hanuki Ryouko]], a dental hygienist who knows the protagonist and Jougasaki
* The [[Fortune Teller (Yojouhan)|Fortune Teller]] who foretells the protagonist's woes
* [[Johnny (Yojouhan)|Johnny]], a personification of the protagonist's sexual desire

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Tatami_Galaxy

title: kashiwazaki_sena
body:
Main character in [[Boku wa Tomodachi ga Sukunai]]. A rich girl with long [[blonde hair]] who is known for her [[large breasts]] and affinity for [[playing_games|gaming]] (particularly [[visual novel]]-style games). Usually wears her signature [[butterfly hair ornament]].

She has an ongoing [[rivalry]] with fellow main character [[Mikazuki Yozora]], who has nicknamed her "Meat" due to her prominent chest. Has a borderline-obsessive fondness for the [[hasegawa_kodaka|protagonist]]'s cute younger sister, [[Hasegawa Kobato]].

Voiced by: [[Itou Kanae]] (JPN), [[Jad Saxton]] (ENG)

title: mikazuki_yozora
body:
Main character in [[Boku wa Tomodachi ga Sukunai]]. The harsh, manipulative founder and leader of the Neighbor's Club. After being caught talking to an imaginary friend by [[Hasegawa Kodaka|]], she decides to start a club for making friends.

Despite her [[tomboy]]ish nature, she is socially inept and prefers to avoid sports and other large group activities. Often seen with [[zettai ryouiki]] to go with her [[school uniform]].

She has an ongoing [[rivalry]] with fellow main character [[Kashiwazaki Sena]] and has nicknamed her "Meat" since she is bothered by the latter's [[large_breasts|large chest]].

[spoiler]She later has her hair cut short, causing Kodaka to realize that she is the friend he made years ago during a fight scene as kids. Disguised as a boy, she went by the alias "Sora" and called him "Taka" in return. She started the Neighbor's Club hoping to bring the two of them back together.[/spoiler]

Voiced by: [[Inoue Marina]] (JPN), [[Sakura Ayane]] (JPN, Child), [[Whitney Rogers]] (ENG)

She is the student council president of Uranohoshi Girls' Academy, and the older sister of [[Kurosawa Ruby]]. Dia is a member of the Aqours sub-unit [[azalea (love live!)|AZALEA]], alongside [[Kunikida Hanamaru]] and [[Matsuura Kanan]].

She has [[aqua eyes]], [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[blunt bangs]], and a [[mole under mouth|mole below her mouth]].

Voiced by [[Komiya Arisa]].

title: vine_boom_(meme)
body:
This tag can refer to two things:

1. A large thudding sound effect largely popularized on [[Vine (company)|]], but still commonly used in memes following the service's closure.
2. A series of [[meme]]s featuring [[The Rock (dwayne johnson)|]] making reaction faces (including [[the rock's eyebrow raise (meme)|his eyebrow raise]]) timed to the sound effect.

title: exercise_ball
body:
A very large, usually inflatable [[ball]] between 14 to 34 inches (35 to 85 cm) in diameter that is used in various exercises.  These exercises are usually to strengthen the back, pelvis, and abdominal muscles.

Known by various names, such as: balance ball, birth ball, body ball, fitness ball, gym ball, gymnastic ball, physio ball, pilates ball, Pezzi ball, stability ball, Swedish ball, Swiss ball, therapy ball, Bosu ball, or yoga ball.

title: pomemori
body: Pomemori is a [[Denonbu]] character. It is the object or animal floating next to [[Reml]]. It is described in the novel as looking like a sheep or a dog and has small bat-like wings. The body is mostly pink, partly purple, and there are seams on the border. It resembles a stuffed animal that is popular among the girls who frequent Kabuki, but those don't float.

title: gundou_misuzu
body:
A deuteragonist from [[Tomo-chan Wa Onna no Ko]].

A friend of [[Kubota Junichirou]] and [[Aizawa Tomo]], acting as the third wheel. While stoic for the most part, she has her mischievous side. Misuzu and Junichirou originally dated prior to the events of the series, but when she wanted to end their relationship out of growing boredom, Junichirou instead approached her and ended their relationship before she could ever do so.

Voiced by [[Hidaka Rina]] (JP) and [[Jad Saxton]] (EN).

title: guin_saga
body: A series of novels beginning in 1979. With 147 books in the main series, of those 130 written by the original author, it is longest single-writer's work in the world. The stories revolve around the titular [[Guin]], a man wearing a leopard mask fused to his head. The series is very well known in Japan, inspiring many manga including [[Berserk]]. Received an anime adaptation in 2009.

title: long_haul_(transformers)
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] [[science fiction]] franchise.

[b]Long Haul[/b] is an evil [i][[Constructicon]][/i] [[Decepticon]], a sentient green, grey and black [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a bright green Hitachi DH321 mining [[dump truck]] (more precisely a [[haul truck]]).

Motto: [i]"A battlefront is only as good as its supply line...".[/i]
